byline.contributor: Saw Nang contributed reporting from Mandalay, Myanmar.

abstract: United Nations and other human rights advocates press Myanmar Army to ease its lockdown in northern part of Rakhine State, which is home to largely Muslim and officially stateless Rohingya ethnic group; military response to attack on guard tower that killed nine police officers has included atrocities against locals and prevented humanitarian aid deliveries.

headline.print_headline: Calls Grow to Ease Military Lockdown in Western Myanmar
headline.main: Calls Grow for Access to Western Myanmar in Face of Military Lockdown

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The security forces have trapped members of the Rohingya ethnic group, a stateless Muslim minority, and largely blocked aid deliveries, advocacy groups say....
lead_paragraph: The security forces have trapped members of the Rohingya ethnic group, a stateless Muslim minority, and largely blocked aid deliveries, advocacy groups say.
